{{Infobox actor | name = Christian LeBlanc | image = Christian LeBlanc.jpg | birth_name = Christian Jules LeBlanc | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|8|25|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Fort Bragg, North Carolina]] | notable role = [[Michael Baldwin]], ''[[The Young and the Restless]]'' | emmyawards = '''[[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series|Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series]]'''
2005, 2007 ''[[The Young and the Restless]]'' }} '''Christian Jules LeBlanc''' (born August 25, 1958 in [[Fort Bragg, North Carolina]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[actor]]. LeBlanc currently plays [[Michael Baldwin]] on ''[[The Young and the Restless]]''. He first played the role from 1991 to 1993, and then resumed the role in 1997. He was nominated for a [[Daytime Emmy Award]] for the role six times, and won for Outstanding Lead Actor award in 2005, 2007, and 2009. He previously starred on another [[soap opera]], ''[[As the World Turns]]'', playing Kirk McColl from June 2, 1983 until the summer of 1985. Christian appeared on ''As The World Turns'' again as his Y&R character Michael Baldwin on April 4 and 5th of 2005 when the character was crossed over to assist Jack and Carly Snyder in a custody suit. He also made a guest appearance on the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] late-night cable TV series ''[[Red Shoe Diaries]]'', and reprised the role for a video movie. LeBlanc also appeared alongside ''[[The Young and the Restless]]'' co-star [[Tracey E. Bregman]] in the video for ''[[I Keep On Loving You]]'' by [[Reba McEntire]] in 2010. On May 20, 2005, June 15, 2007, and August 30, 2009, LeBlanc won the Daytime Emmy for "[[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series|Outstanding Lead Actor]]" for his role on ''Y&R''. He was previously nominated for "[[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series|Outstanding Supporting Actor]]" in 1999, 2000, 2003 and 2004. ==Roles== *''[[The Young and the Restless]]'' - [[Michael Baldwin]] (1991â1993; April 1997âPresent) *''The Game: Red Shoe Diaries'' (2000) *''The Disturbance at Dinner'' - Pat in the Box (1997) *''Perry Mason: The Case of the Killer Kiss'' (1993) *''Seeds of Tragedy'' - Driver (1991) *''[[In the Heat of the Night (TV series)|In the Heat of the Night]]''- Patrolman Junior Abernathy (1988) *''[[As the World Turns]]'' - [[Kirk McColl]] (1983â1985), [[Michael Baldwin]] (2005) *''[[Guiding Light]]'' - Justin (2009) ==Awards and nominations== *Daytime Emmys Winner, Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series (2005, 2007, 2009) *Daytime Emmys Nomination, Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series (1999, 2000, 2003, 2004, 2011) *Daytime Emmys Pre-Nomination, Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series (2005, 2006, 2008) *Daytime Emmys Pre-Nomination, Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series (2003, 2004) *Soap Opera Digest Award Nominee, Favorite Return (1998) ==Notes== *Christian LeBlanc is no relation to television actor [[Matt LeBlanc]], who played [[Joey Tribbiani]] on the [[sitcom]] ''[[Friends]]''. *Christian LeBlanc appears in the video clip "[[I Keep On Loving You]]" by [[Reba McEntire]]. ==External links== *{{imdb name|0495672}} *[http://www.christianjleblanc.com/ Christian LeBlanc's Official Website] {{Daytime Emmy Award Outstanding Lead Actor 2004-2013}} {{Persondata | NAME =Leblanc, Christian | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =August 25, 1958 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Fort Bragg, North Carolina]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leblanc, Christian}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American people of French descent]] [[Category:Jesuit High School alumni]] [[Category:American soap opera actors]] [[Category:Daytime Emmy Award winners]] [[Category:Tulane University alumni]] [[Category:People from New Orleans, Louisiana]] [[fr:Christian LeBlanc]] [[nl:Christian LeBlanc]] [[pl:Christian LeBlanc]]
